title.rendered: No, Chema Alonso is not investing in BitCoins.  It’s a scam with Fake News now using my image.  #BitCoin #scams #Cryptocurrencies

content.rendered:
A little over a month ago I told you how they used the image of people like David Broncano, Daniel Rovira, Karlos Arguinano either Charles Slim to capture victims through Malvertising and Fake News campaigns. The hook is a supposed news in which it is told how a person narrates his success formula to earn a lot of money with BitCoins. I talked about this in the “Bad Guys Never Sleep” talk.

Figure 1: No, Chema Alonso is not investing in BitCoins.
It’s a scam with Fake News now using my image.
#BitCoin #scams #Cryptocurrencies

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4lzuZCXHO8A
Figure 2: Bad Guys Never Sleep

Now, for several days, they have started using my image in similar articles to capture victims who hand over their money. Same scam, but now using me. So I have written this article so that you are clear that if you see any similar publication, or they tell you that they have seen something like this, know that it is a scam.

Figure 3: Site on Google in Cyrillic

It makes me sad that in the end they deceive people with my image, so if you can tell everyone, all the better. Make it clear to them thatNo, Chema Alonso is not investing in BitCoins or other Cryptocurrencies”And just in case… “I am not preparing my departure from my beloved Telefónica either”and it is already the second time in three years that they use the same trick to gain audience.

Figure 4: The alleged company “Crisis AID” is one of the names that are changing page by page, but the amount is usually around that: €250

As a curious hook they again use my passage through the anthill, what was in the year 2014, and where I talked about other things. After the anthill I brought the affection of Trancas and Barrancas, but I have not gone back to tell anything like what they say.

Figure 5: Scam with the hook of my passage through the anthill

Cryptocurrencies are an investment for risky people, but in this case it is not even about investing. It is simply a scam where you give money and never earn anything. At the end of the news, what it is about is that the victim opens an account and voluntarily makes an income.

Figure 6: At the end, the victim is asked to send the money.

I have seen many people scammed with this type of scheme, and you can tell anyone who tells you about this type of news. In addition, they accompany it with videos in Facebook and Instagramall with a hook of my image.

Figure 7: Video of victim recruitment in RRSS (Instagram and Facebook)

Cryptocurrencies, and BitCoin par excellence, are technologies that are difficult to control and understand in all their variants. I continue to recommend the book by Felix Brezo and Yaiza Rubio on “BitCoin: BlockChain and its investigation”, which explains many basic concepts to understand this world that is not as easy as many paint it.

We hope that the security forces end up putting these groups of swindlers behind bars, although sometimes it takes them time to put together the complete case, in the end they end up being arrested like many of the gangs that have already ended up in front of justice. But warn your friends and family of these types of scams.

Evil greetings!
